FuncDef:
The clock input-threshold command configures a lower threshold for the input quality level of a clock source.
The undo clock input-threshold command restores the default configuration. The clock input-threshold command configures a lower threshold for the input quality level of a clock source. The undo clock input-threshold command restores the default configuration. By default, the lower threshold for the input quality level of a clock source is sec. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H-48S6CQ, CE6881H-48S6CQ-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: clock input-threshold { dnu | prc | sec | ssua | ssub }
undo clock input-threshold [ dnu | prc | sec | ssua | ssub ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the clock source is not synchronized.
-

Indicates that the lower threshold for the input quality level of a clock source is for G.811 clock signals.
-

Indicates that the lower threshold for the input quality level of a clock source is for SDH device clock signals.
-

Indicates that the lower threshold for the input quality level of a clock source is for G.812 transit node clock signals.
-

Indicates that the lower threshold for the input quality level of a clock source is for G.812 local node clock signals.
-
